page.title: 11CHURCH STRETTON GOLF CLUB
page.content: The Golf Club was founded in 1898. It is about{1200 feet above sea level. It is the second highest in England. From the second tee you can see nearly all of Church Stretton, and from the Golf Course are some of the finest views in the world. The Golf Course is a very difficult one. It is very hilly. There are 18 holes. If you go off the fairway, you have to be lucky to find your ball. On the third hole you have to be lucky not to hit it down the valley. There are 305 members. There are 190 full male members, 40 lady members, 50 junior members and 25 social members. There is a junior evening every Friday and this year two of our juniors have played for the County. The annual subscription rate for male members in 1985 is Â£98.
